data.title: Seating improvement needed
data.text: Saw a concert at this venue and while it is a beautiful old building it would benefit by updating the seats. I had a good view but found the rows too close together leaving no legroom and feeling very cramped all evening.

data.title: Grand old theater
data.text: What a grand old theater that is still in serious need of being finished.  The areas that have been restored are amazing – the entry, concessions, and bathrooms are top notch.  The remainder appears to be falling apart as we speak with plaster coming down everywhere and paint desperately needed.  The seats are old and less than comfortable but overall the experience of a show here was really cool.  I’m hoping they can generate the funds to finish the restoration because it will be quite the sight to see.

data.title: Leo Kottke was amazing - dress warmly
data.text:
Always sit as close as you can.  Everything is better up there.  Of course the other seats are fine too.  The sound system was great.

Not sure why it was so cold.  Leo even mentioned it and I think they turned up the heat.

data.title: Beautiful night at the Orpheum
data.text: I have been to the Orpheum many times though out my life. I recently seen Peter Frampton.  My seat was about 12 rows back, the view was awesome and the sound was great.  There is not a bad seat in the house. The alcohol is about normal priced for an event.  I would not hesitate to see an event here again.

data.title: Beautiful Theater and Concert Venue
data.text: I went with some friends to see Donny Edwards here last night. The theater itself is beautiful and has a great atmosphere. The concert was wonderful, and that was certainly helped by the good acoustics of the theater and the attentiveness of the staff.

data.title: Classic Room
data.text: Enjoyed a great blues concert here with friends.  It's a great sized house and easy to get in and out of.  They need to accelerate their facilities though. Carpets need repair and those seats are rough after 2.5 hours.

data.title: Great Venue that is improving as its being restored
data.text: I've been to the Orpheum for concerts, comedy acts and even church!  Its a classical-style theater that is being restored as the money comes in.  That means the place is alternately irritating and charming, depending on your POV.  The bathrooms are great, but on the second floor.  The bar is great, but its behind the back rows of the lower venue.  The balcony is great for a view, but the seats are cramped and steep.  If you go in being realistic, you should have a good time.  The intimacy of the venue is PERFECT for concerts and I've seen lots there.
